title: Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666 - Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)

Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature eats too much code. To reproduce the issue, follow the steps below:

Steps:
1. Open a file in the UI that triggers the code assist feature.
2. Edit the code in a way that the code assist feature is triggered.
3. Notice that the code assist removes more code than necessary when making a specific function call.

Expected Behavior (EB):
The code should preserve the existing code and only insert the necessary parameter for the function call.

Observed Behavior (OB):
The code assist feature removes more code than necessary when adding a parameter to a function call. The code is changed to:

```
baz(x.foo().foo())
```

I would rather it gave me:

```
baz(x.foo(), x.foo())
```

This behavior causes incorrect program behavior.
